chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
I see you're eager to hear my humble opinion on resolving this question. I hope that in God's abundant goodness, which is always so rich, even our poverty can be enriched by it. From this goodness, He gives as much as He wants to others while He remains fully complete in it. He will graciously infuse our hearts with spiritual insights that will be beneficial for us to speak and for you to hear.

The words we share with you in God's grace also benefit us if we, too, listen to ourselves internally with meekness and humility. It's not without reason that the most holy David says, "I will hear what the Lord God will speak in me" (Psalm 85:9). This kind of hearing is specifically for the humble. For this reason, the same prophet says elsewhere, "You will give joy and gladness to my hearing, and the humbled bones will rejoice" (Psalm 51:10).

In another place, the majesty itself speaks like this: "Upon whom will my Spirit rest, if not upon the humble and quiet, and those who tremble at my words" (Isaiah 66:2)? The Spirit of God does not rest on the humble and quiet without making them humble and quiet, but finds them as such to rest upon. The Spirit graciously rests on the humble and quiet because He makes them humble and quiet.

Therefore, the Holy Spirit works to expel the vice of pride and restlessness from the person on whom He rests. Through the preceding action of the Holy Spirit, mercifully changing the person's will, the freely given remission of sins dissolves every bond of past human iniquity.
chunks.original_latin:
In hujus absolutione quaestionis flagitare vos
video parvitatis nostrae sententiam. Proinde spero
in abundantia bonitatis Dei, qua sic est ille semper
 dives, ut exinde nostra quoque possit ditari pauperies,
et ex qua caeteris quantum vult sic donat, ut in
ea plenius ipse permaneat; quia talia nostro cordi
spiritaliter dignabitur infundere, quae et nobis dicere
prosit, et vobis audire. Sermo enim quem vobis
in Dei gratia ministramus, tunc etiam nobis prodest,
si quod vobis pro salute verbo styloque foris dicimus,
nos intus mites et humiles audiamus. Non enim
frustra David sanctissimus dicit: Audiam quid loquatur
in me Dominus Deus (Psal LXXXIV 9). Qui auditus
proprie ad humiles pertinet. Propter quod alio
loco idem propheta dicit: Auditui meo dabis gaudium
 et laetitiam, et exsultabunt ossa humiliata (Psal L 10). Alio loco majestas ipsa sic loquitur: Super quem requiescet
Spiritus meus, nisi super humilem et quietum,
et trementem verba mea (Isai LXVI 2)? Nec vero iste
Spiritus Dei sic super humilem et quietum requiescit,
ut non ipse quietum humilemque faciat, sed
tanquam humilem quietumque requieturus inveniat. In eo quippe super humilem et quietum dignatur
requiescere, quia super quem requiescit, quietum et
humilem facit. Hoc ergo Spiritus sanctus operatur,
ut vitium superbiae atque inquietudinis ab homine in
quo requiescit, expellat; ac sic praeveniente sancti
362 Spiritus operatione, hominis voluntatem misericorditer
immutante, omne praeteritae humanae iniquitatis
vinculum gratis data solvat remissio peccatorum.
